intro: Sphaeralcea axillaris, commonly known as the desert four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow or orange flowers that open in the late afternoon. It has hairy, branching stems and small, elliptical leaves that are adapted to arid environments. Sphaeralcea axillaris is often found in sandy soils and is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
